messages.title: A STRONG VOICE FOR OUR AREA
messages.content:
Jon Nicholas is the Liberal Democrat candidate for Bournemouth East. Jon’s work takes him all over the constituency and beyond to schools and community projects. He works on a wide range of inclusion projects which have given him powerful insight into some of the most vulnerable people and communities locally and beyond.

“My work has given me first-hand experience of the challenges Bournemouth and the rest of the UK are currently facing in my regular contact with teachers, health workers, the police, and most importantly, residents. They tell me that this Tory Government does not feel helpful, useful or kind.

This election is the most important of my voting life, and I am running for the people of Bournemouth East to help unite the town against a Tory party that would rather divide it.”

messages.title: BREXIT IS CAUSING PRICES TO RISE
messages.content:
"UK inflation rate leaps to 2.3%" 
Food prices UP
Petrol prices UP
These are worrying times

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Jon will defend our NHS and stop further Conservative cuts. With waiting lists at record levels and hospitals stretched to breaking point, the Lib Dems will raise an extra £6 billion each year to properly fund health and social care.

Jon is fighting Conservative plans for a hard Brexit. Bournemouth’s major employers including the financial sector, language schools, universities, and tourist trade rely heavily on trading with Europe for its prosperity.

The Tories aren’t giving local schools the money they need. The Lib Dems are campaigning for schools in Bournemouth to be funded with an extra £26 million, ensuring they can continue to give high quality education for local children.
